instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message:
This 12" Macbook had liquid spilled on the keyboard by the customer. It had liquid damage to only 2 components that I could see. <CAPACITOR>C7671</CAPACITOR>/2 were both corroded so I replaced both of them.

After plugging in the charger I keep getting a chime every few seconds and the machine keeps turning on and off. I can tell it is turning on and off because I can feel the trackpad when I click it while the machine is chiming. I tried unplugging the keyboard and trackpad but yet the issue remains.
Also, the board does get warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> steady at 3v?
I saw recent post with the same issue, check it too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message: Yes <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> stays at 3.29v the whole time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message: What is getting warm? These boards should not really get warm very fast. I have seen them with bad CPUs that get very hot fast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message: There is no specific component that is getting unusually warm. When I feel around it seems like the entire board is getting slightly warm after about 30 seconds. I removed the CPU heatsink and felt the cpu and it gets warm but not extremely hot that would have me suspecting it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in chime boot loop
threads.message: Connect external keyboard and get into boot menu and boot from external source. Corrupted SSD can make machine reboot.
